text:
I was attempting both with `name` and `portalId` yesterday with the "--account" parameter in `hs upload`. Attempting to use any version of them today still doesn't reproduce..

Re-reading your comment: I don't believe so, as the proccess is fairly streamlined (hs init)

The portalId went from a number to a string now when I used a `hs watch` command. I turned it manually back into a number, but attempting to hs watch again did not change it into a string.

I did not use the --account parameter and my defaultPortal was set to my sandbox. The portalId it changed was my prod portalId - this is the top/first listed account/portal in the .yml file.
It's noteworthy that it is always and only this first one that gets its portalId turned into a string from a number - even though it's not the account/portal I'm working towards at the time

Hi! I did make a new array of blog_post and now I do need to access the content like this:

```post[0].url```
Which is fine, but after every save it will reformat to post..url. Is there maybe another way of accessing the content within an array, or can I change something in the settings so it will not format it like this.
I am having the exact same problem Anthony - did you ever resolve this?

Hi all - having a really basic issue with the CLI via VSCode.  I'm executing a basic `hs upload` command and I get a confirmation saying that it worked - however when I check my Design Tools there has been no upload.  I've executed a `hs fetch` which pulled the files down initially so I know that my config is all correct.  It just doesn't seem to send the files up ... I must be missing something basic?

If you haven’t already, I suggest double-checking the value of `defaultPortal` in your HubSpot.config.yml. The CLI likes to randomly change that setting sometimes — if that’s happened, you might be uploading to the wrong environment.
Thanks Ev - I've double checked just to be sure and its all correct - sigh.
The sandboxAccountType: null line has me wondering if that should be something as mine is a sandbox account?
